ANU.name: Greg Weeks
expertise: Law And Legal Studies Not Elsewhere Classified
interest: Greg's research interests are in judicial review and issues in public law generally, state liability, and public and private law remedies against public authorities. He supervises undergraduate research theses and postgraduate research in these, and related, fields.
ANU.biography: Greg Weeks is an Associate Professor in the ANU College of Law. He previously worked in the Faculty of Law at the University of New South Wales and and has also taught law at UTS and the University of Sydney. He holds undergraduate degrees in Arts (History) from the University of Sydney and Law from UNSW, and a PhD from UNSW. Prior to commencing an academic career, Greg practiced as a solicitor in the litigation group of a large national firm.  He is widely recognised as an expert in administrative law and is an author of many publications in that and related areas, including the 6th edition of Judicial Review of Administrative Action and Government Liability, the leading Australian administrative law text.
